sections.heading: What are Frequency Expressions?
sections.content:
Frequency expressions describe how often something happens. Japanese has many adverbs to express different levels of frequency, from "always" to "never."

いつも勉強する "I always study" 時々映画を見る "I sometimes watch movies" 全然行かない "I never go"

children.heading: Always/Usually (100% - 80%)
children.content: いつも - always 常に - always (formal) 必ず - without fail/always 毎回 - every time いつも朝ごはんを食べる "I always eat breakfast" 必ず宿題をする "I always do homework without fail"

children.heading: Often/Frequently (70% - 50%)
children.content: よく - often しょっちゅう - frequently/all the time 頻繁に - frequently (formal) よく本を読む "I often read books" しょっちゅう会う "We meet frequently"

children.heading: Sometimes (40% - 20%)
children.content: 時々 (ときどき) - sometimes たまに - occasionally 時には (ときには) - sometimes 時々映画を見る "I sometimes watch movies" たまに外食する "I occasionally eat out"

children.heading: Rarely/Seldom (10% - 5%)
children.content: たまに - occasionally (can mean rarely in context) めったに〜ない - rarely/seldom あまり〜ない - not often めったに行かない "I rarely go" あまり食べない "I don't eat often"

children.heading: Never (0%)
children.content: 全然〜ない - never/not at all 一度も〜ない - never (not even once) 決して〜ない - never (emphatic) 全然行かない "I never go" 一度も食べたことがない "I've never eaten it (not even once)"

sections.heading: Frequency Scale
sections.content: 100% いつも/常に (always) 90% ほとんどいつも (almost always) 80% だいたい (usually) 70% よく (often) 50% 時々 (sometimes) 30% たまに (occasionally) 10% めったに〜ない (rarely) 5% ほとんど〜ない (hardly ever) 0% 全然〜ない (never)

sections.heading: Placement in Sentences
sections.content:
Frequency adverbs typically come before the verb :

Subject + Frequency + Verb 私はいつも朝ごはんを食べる "I always eat breakfast" 彼はよく本を読む "He often reads books" 時々映画を見ます "I sometimes watch movies"

children.heading: めったに〜ない (rarely)
children.content: めったに外食しない "I rarely eat out" めったに遅刻しない "I rarely arrive late" めったに会わない "We rarely meet"

children.heading: あまり〜ない (not much/often)
children.content: あまり飲まない "I don't drink much" あまり行かない "I don't go often" あまり話さない "I don't talk much"

children.heading: 全然〜ない (not at all/never)
children.content: 全然わからない "I don't understand at all" 全然行かない "I never go" 全然食べない "I don't eat at all"

children.heading: 一度も〜ない (not even once/never)
children.content: 一度も行ったことがない "I've never been (not even once)" 一度も見たことがない "I've never seen it" 一度も会ったことがない "I've never met (them)"

children.heading: どのくらい (how often)
children.content: どのくらい運動しますか？ "How often do you exercise?" どのくらい日本に行きますか？ "How often do you go to Japan?"

children.heading: よく (often - in questions)
children.content: よく映画を見ますか？ "Do you often watch movies?" よくここに来ますか？ "Do you come here often?"

children.heading: Every [time period]
children.content: 毎日 (まいにち) - every day 毎週 (まいしゅう) - every week 毎月 (まいつき) - every month 毎年 (まいとし) - every year 毎朝 (まいあさ) - every morning 毎晩 (まいばん) - every evening 毎日運動する "I exercise every day" 毎週映画を見る "I watch movies every week"

children.heading: Times per Period
children.content: 1日に3回 - 3 times a day 週に2回 - twice a week 月に1回 - once a month 年に1回 - once a year 週に2回ジムに行く "I go to the gym twice a week" 月に1回会う "We meet once a month"

children.heading: Example 1: Exercise Habits
children.content: A: どのくらい運動しますか？ "How often do you exercise?" B: 週に3回ぐらい運動します "I exercise about 3 times a week" A: 何をしますか？ "What do you do?" B: よく走ります "I often run"

children.heading: Example 2: Meeting Friends
children.content: A: 友達とよく会いますか？ "Do you often meet with friends?" B: はい、週末はいつも会います "Yes, I always meet on weekends" A: 平日は？ "What about weekdays?" B: たまに会います "I occasionally meet"

children.heading: Example 3: Eating Habits
children.content: A: よく外食しますか？ "Do you often eat out?" B: いいえ、あまりしません "No, not much" A: 週に何回ぐらい？ "About how many times a week?" B: 月に1回ぐらいです "About once a month"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong particle with frequency
children.content: Wrong: 週に2回で行く ❌ Right: 週に2回行く ✓ "I go twice a week"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Forgetting ない with negative frequency
children.content: Wrong: めったに行く ❌ Right: めったに行かない ✓ "I rarely go"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong word order
children.content: Less natural: 勉強するいつも ⚠️ Natural: いつも勉強する ✓ "I always study"

children.heading: Multiple Adverbs
children.content: ほとんどいつも "almost always" たいてい/だいたい "usually/generally" ほとんど〜ない "hardly ever"

children.heading: With Time Periods
children.content: 平日はいつも仕事する "I always work on weekdays" 週末はたまに出かける "I occasionally go out on weekends" 朝はよく走る "I often run in the morning"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: よく - often 時々 - sometimes たまに - occasionally 全然〜ない - never

children.heading: Formal
children.content: 頻繁に - frequently 時には - sometimes 稀に - rarely 決して〜ない - never

children.heading: たびに (every time)
children.content: 会うたびに "every time we meet" 行くたびに "every time I go" 見るたびに "every time I see"

children.heading: いつでも (anytime)
children.content: いつでも来てください "Please come anytime" いつでも電話していい "You can call anytime"

children.heading: いつまでも (forever)
children.content: いつまでも友達 "friends forever" いつまでも覚えている "I'll remember forever"

children.heading: 本当に (really)
children.content: 本当によく会う "We really meet often" 本当に全然わからない "I really don't understand at all"

children.heading: とても (very)
children.content: とてもよく勉強する "I study very often"

children.heading: Standard
children.content: よく - often 時々 - sometimes

children.heading: Kansai
children.content: よう - often たまに - sometimes

children.heading: High Frequency
children.content: いつも早く起きる "I always wake up early" 毎日日本語を勉強する "I study Japanese every day" よく本を読みます "I often read books" しょっちゅう会う "We meet frequently"

children.heading: Medium Frequency
children.content: 時々映画を見る "I sometimes watch movies" たまに外食します "I occasionally eat out" 週に2回ジムに行く "I go to the gym twice a week"

children.heading: Low Frequency
children.content: めったに行かない "I rarely go" あまり食べません "I don't eat much" ほとんど使わない "I hardly ever use it"

children.heading: Never
children.content: 全然わからない "I don't understand at all" 一度も行ったことがない "I've never been" 決して忘れない "I'll never forget"

children.heading: Questions
children.content: どのくらい運動しますか？ "How often do you exercise?" よく映画を見ますか？ "Do you often watch movies?" 毎日勉強しますか？ "Do you study every day?"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Time Words - Specific time expressions Duration - How long Present Tense Usage - Habitual actions Adverbs - Adverb usage Negative Forms - Negation patterns Counters - Counting times
